description: This Java class defines the 'Recipe' entity for the backend model, including properties like id, title, description, cookTimeMinutes, servings, category, ingredients, and createdAt, along with their getters and setters. It uses JPA annotations to specify database mappings.

classes.name: Recipe
classes.description: Entity representing a cooking recipe with properties such as title, description, cook time, servings, category, ingredients, and creation timestamp. Mapped to 'recipes' table in the database.

methods.name: getId
methods.description: Returns the unique identifier of the recipe.

methods.name: setId
methods.description: Sets the unique identifier of the recipe.

methods.name: getTitle
methods.description: Returns the title of the recipe.

methods.name: setTitle
methods.description: Sets the title of the recipe.

methods.name: getDescription
methods.description: Returns the description of the recipe.

methods.name: setDescription
methods.description: Sets the description of the recipe.

methods.name: getCookTimeMinutes
methods.description: Returns the cooking time in minutes.

methods.name: setCookTimeMinutes
methods.description: Sets the cooking time in minutes.

methods.name: getCategory
methods.description: Returns the category object associated with the recipe.

methods.name: setCategory
methods.description: Associates a category with the recipe.

methods.name: getIngredients
methods.description: Returns the list of ingredients for the recipe.

methods.name: setIngredients
methods.description: Sets the ingredients list for the recipe.
